ddir 0.14.3
  • Reference
    • Load compound-specific data

Read csv-formatted CYP TDI data

read_tdi_data.Rd

This function reads comma-separated CYP TDI data from a file or text connection.

Usage

read_tdi_data(source)

Arguments

source

The connection to read from.

Value

A data frame.

Details

The following fields are expected (in this order):

  • 'name' The perpetrator compound name as character.

  • 'cyp' The CYP enzyme as (upper case) character.

  • 'ki' The \(K_I\) in µM as numeric.

  • 'kinact' The \(k_{inact}\) in \(1/h\) as numeric.

  • 'source' Optional source information as character. Lines starting with '#' are interpreted as comments and are not evaluated.

A valid data set is, e.g.,

      # compound, CYP, Ki, Kinact, source
      examplinib, CYP3A4, 0.17,   0.04, study 001
